page.title: 20WESTONZOYLAND
page.content: ON THE WESTONZOYLAND ROAD THERE IS AN ELECTRICITY SUB-STATION WHICH GENERATES 132,000 VOLTS.IT IS SURROUNDED BY 29 PYLONS WHICH CARRY THE CURRENT.NEARBY IS THE HALFWAY INN WHICH HAS BEEN ESPECIALLY DECORATED BY WHITBREADS,THE BREWERS,TO COMMEMORATE THE BATTLE OF SEDGEMOOR.A TYPICAL BAR MEAL OF SCAMPI AND CHIPS WOULD COST ABOUT Â£2.50.WESTONZOYLAND IS A LARGE VILLAGE OF ABOUT 1,500 PEOPLE.IT HAS TWO CHURCHES-THE PARISH CHURCH WHERE THE REBELS WERE SHUT UP AFTER THE BATTLE OF SEDGEMOOR,AND A METHODIST CHURCH.THESEALED KNOT SOCIETY RE-ENACTED THE BATTLE THERE THIS YEAR. IN CHEDZOY WE ALSO DRESSED IN COSTUME, WE MOUNTED AN EXHIBITION ABOUT THE BATTLE AND STAGED A FLOWER FESTIVAL IN THE CHURCH.ALSO THE B.B.C.USED PARCHEY BRIDGE TO MAKE SCENES FROM A T.V. FILM "THE MONOCLED MUTINEER".
